message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SD

The paper proposes a novel approach for training generative adversarial networks (GANs) using binary neurons, which can be applied to various computer vision tasks such as image generation and classification. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), which is the main focus of the paper. Additionally, since the proposed model is applied to generate binarized MNIST digits, cs.CV (Computer Vision) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of sigmoid-adjusted straight-through estimators for estimating gradients, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning and falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Furthermore, the paper experiments with different types of binary neurons and GAN objectives, which are related to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.SD (Software Engineering), respectively.
